channel.title: Chat logs displaying time AND AM/PM HELP!
channel.description:
Ok. I've recently made it so my yell command gets logged so I can read what people say there. Here's what I want to do. I made it so it also displays the time the message was said and let's say the time is 10.23.46..1. 10 is the hour 23 is the minute 46 is the seconds and 1 is pm. If it were am, it would display a 0 instead. How can I make it so instead of displaying 0 and 1 as am and pm, I can make it say AM and PM instead? Here's my integer code for the am and pm.
[code] public int ampm = cal.get(Calendar.AM_PM); // 0=AM, 1=PM[/code]
Where would I go to change it? If you need me to supply any more codes, tell me and I will. Thanks in advance.

item.title: Chat logs displaying time AND AM/PM HELP!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:10, topic:276718”]Ahh crap lol. Naww I didn’t :P. I added them to my backup client class instead of my real one by mistake. Alright I compiled with no errors. and OMG! Look how nice this came out in my logs:

Date: 04/30/2009 | Time: 11:09:29 PM | joe miller: hi

Wow! Thanks a lot guys… Lol. I’ll be repping you Newty. ;)[/quote]

Yeah it look’s awesome doesn’t it

Read full topic

item.title: Chat logs displaying time AND AM/PM HELP!
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Alright xx qwertyuiop xx, I used your method and it worked. it came up as AM and PM so I love you. I wanted to try out Newty’s way too since it puts the date and time in one string and when I added his codes I came with this error:

client.java:6448: cannot find symbol symbol : class Date location: class client public static String date = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy").format(new Da te()); ^ client.java:6448: cannot find symbol symbol : class SimpleDateFormat location: class client public static String date = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy").format(new Da te()); ^ client.java:6449: cannot find symbol symbol : class Date location: class client public static String time = new SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm:ss").format(new Date ()); ^ client.java:6449: cannot find symbol symbol : class SimpleDateFormat location: class client public static String time = new SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm:ss").format(new Date ()); ^ client.java:12992: cannot find symbol symbol : class Date location: class client String date = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy").format(new Date ()); ^ client.java:12992: cannot find symbol symbol : class SimpleDateFormat location: class client String date = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy").format(new Date ()); ^ client.java:12993: cannot find symbol symbol : class Date location: class client String time = new SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm:ss").format(new Date() ); ^ client.java:12993: cannot find symbol symbol : class SimpleDateFormat location: class client String time = new SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm:ss").format(new Date() ); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Note: SYIBlocker.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 8 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Did you forget to give me SimpleDateFormat method or something…?

Read full topic
item.source: Chat logs displaying time AND AM/PM HELP!

item.title: Chat logs displaying time AND AM/PM HELP!
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:5, topic:276718”]Yeah, instead of 0 and 1. SO I basically took what you posted and replaced my old one with it and I get this error back:

client.java:6447: ';' expected private string ampm = cal.get(Calendar.AM_PM) == 0 ? "AM" : "PM" ^ client.java:12989: ';' expected string ampm = cal.get(Calendar.AM_PM) == 0 ? "AM" : "PM" ^ 2 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

I’m wondering what this is for: == 0 ? "AM" : "PM"[/quote]
Oh, that’s a ternary operator. It’s basically an if-else block condensed into a single statement. http://mindprod.com/jgloss/ternaryoperator.html

Anyways, you need a semi-colon at the end of that statement.

Read full topic
item.source: Chat logs displaying time AND AM/PM HELP!

item.title: Chat logs displaying time AND AM/PM HELP!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Posted this on rserver before:

import java.text.DateFormat;
import java.text.*;
import java.util.*;

public static String date = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy").format(new Date());

public static String time = new SimpleDateFormat("hh:mm:ss").format(new Date());

bw.write(msg+" | On "+ date +" At "+ time); //Bufferedwriter, if you don't understand this, dont use it, missing the BufferedWriter Import, because I just posted this part as an example usage.

Read full topic
